post.body: full IDE's turned out to be a bit heavy for me after using TM for a few years. I like the light weight.
I used NetBeans a while back and went back to TM
my pleasure my friend
http://chi.mp/ is down for my, but robertdempsey.mp is working well
I quit smoking years ago, one thing that worked was taking a short walk rather than smoke, take the same time you did smoking
Dell learned that lesson real quick, and all business support is here in the US, though consumer is still in India.
no rest for the weary! now get back to work!
I would say that is an accurate statement
Now, I am really heading to bed. G'night all.
Off to bed. Looking forward to another great day tomorrow. Then the 4th - my wife and daughter's birthdays. It
New blog post: A Nice "Thank You" From Chrysler: http://tinyurl.com/9mlzdt
I've looked at Expresso and will now check out Coda and VIM. Thanks for the suggestions all.
I've got Internet in my pocket. Awesome.
My first real coding session of 2009. It feels great. I can't wait for Rails 3. This year is going to rock.
My first cup of tea in Thailand - Chinese tea. It is delicious. I miss my Adagio.
IMO, TextMate is still the best. Any worthy challengers I should take a look at? So far full IDE's have been too slow and memory hungry.
OAuth is looking like such a better alternative every day: http://tinyurl.com/7wq2gt
Time for breakfast and a new day. The local internet cafe offered my free wifi. I'm going to take them up on that offer. Great people here.
I'm all for this one: http://www.tgdaily.com/content/view/40785/140/ Let go of IE6, just, let go.
New blog post: Happy New Year 2009 http://tinyurl.com/8rdqeo
